posts.post_content:
T206 paddy livingston signed amerian beauty back for sale. PM for more details.
Besides it being signed, there is between PSA and SGC a total of 6 t206 paddy livingston american beauty 350 w/ frame graded.

[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/nLJ87Wc.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]https://i.imgur.com/2zaWcwy.jpg[/IMG]

I am going to try and cross the card to PSA if a sale doesnt happen.
At the risk of seeming impolite, how do you know the autograph is real? If your answer is it’s certified by SGC, that isn’t a good answer.

[quote name="HobokenJon" post=1869780]At the risk of seeming impolite, how do you know the autograph is real? If your answer is it’s certified by SGC, that isn’t a good answer.[/QUOTE]


That was very impolite. I don’t know the seller, but I think you owe this guy an apology

Infraction and warning given. This is the wrong place for that kind of rhetoric. 

[quote name="HobokenJon" post=1869780]At the risk of seeming impolite, how do you know the autograph is real? If your answer is it’s certified by SGC, that isn’t a good answer.[/QUOTE]

[quote name="HobokenJon" post=1869780]At the risk of seeming impolite, how do you know the autograph is real? If your answer is it’s certified by SGC, that isn’t a good answer.[/QUOTE]

SGC determined the autograph to be real, hence the SGC Authentic tag being used in addition to the number grade.
As far as i know the autograph is real. If there is proof that it is not real I have no problem taking the card down.
Besides it being signed, there is between PSA and SGC a total of 6 t206 paddy livingston american beauty 350 w/ frame graded.

I will say this...

Paddy Livingston was known for signing his name on the back of cards - seems to be especially so w/ T206s.  So I think you’re off to a good start on the authenticity track.  I personally have a signed Livingston (common back) and the card was likewise autographed on the reverse.

[quote name="scottglevy" post=1870008]I will say this...

Paddy Livingston was known for signing his name on the back of cards - seems to be especially so w/ T206s.  So I think you’re off to a good start on the authenticity track.  I personally have a signed Livingston (common back) and the card was likewise autographed on the reverse.[/QUOTE

I have look at comparable autographs of his and it looks good to me. But I am in no way an autograph expert.
